title: Fonts with a dramatic question mark?
content:
Name names if you know of any fonts with an exciting, contrasting question mark. Nothing stiff...flowing. Far from Helvetica's. No need for serifs.   
   
Thanks
author: emp

comments.content:
correction:   
   
They can be serif fonts, since there are good question marks available in serif faces.

Gill Sans has some nice question marks. Quadraat too.   
And there's Australis, but I guess it's not for sale yet.
Stempel Schneidler has the most unique question mark of all.

This is from an old letterpressed book.   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150306061419im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/30/20387.jpg)

The "reverse S" of Futura Book.   
Another interesting idea: the dot and the vertical stroke on an extreme side axis, as in Britannic.
The Hoefler Type Foundry's _Gestalt_ has a unique question mark.
